channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NC
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NC

item.title: Report X-2023070842
item.description:
Report X-2023070842

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-05T21:09:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-07
  • City: NEWTON
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: While unloading trailer, package was wet and brought to QA. It was discovered cap was missing from 1 gallon jug. Package placed in hazmat plastic bag and bin. DescribePack: Box was wet and had hole top side of jug with missing cap. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Neutralizer placed on spillage.

item.title: Report X-2023070754
item.description:
Report X-2023070754

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-05T21:09:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-03
  • City: LINCOLNTON
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package came off semi trailer leaking. Packaging was sufficient- package seemed to have been dropped ( or possibly a heavy item placed on top) causing box to crush in on one side. This caused two cans to dent in and one to crack, all liquid leaked out of the one can that was cracked, the other dented can did not leak. The entire package was put into a tote bin and sent to QA. DescribePack: The metal cans dented and one cracked at the corner of the can where it was dented. It was a very small crack, but liquid leaked out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was put into a tote bin, initially taken to QA, I then took the tote bin and moved it to an isolated and well ventilated area. Package was then put into the Hazmat Cage.

item.title: Report X-2023070728
item.description:
Report X-2023070728

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-05T21:09:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-03
  • City: NEWTON
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: FedEx Driver report spill when he opened back of delivery van. Hepaco was contacted for on-site Hazmat cleanup. Maelon Asbourne of Hepaco, Charlotte, NC. (704) 390-6690. DescribePack: Plastic tub was turned over in back of delivery van with contents spilling out. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: Called Hazmat clean up and driver moved vehicle to location away from building and people.

item.title: Report X-2023070713
item.description:
Report X-2023070713

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-05T21:09:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-03
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: While being loaded, the package was discovered to be wet on the top side. The package was placed under the belt, and QA was informed of its condition and location. DescribePack: The caps of two of the bottles had become loose, causing some fluid to be released and soak the top of the outer packaging. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed in a hazmat tote and taken to the nearest QA cage for further processing.

item.title: Report X-2023070609
item.description:
Report X-2023070609

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-01T03:13:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-29
  • City: WHITSETT
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found to be leaking from the bottom of the plastic 5 gallon container during the preload sort. Container had then been moved into a blue hazmat bag and placed in a yellow container away from other packages. DescribePack: Failure occurred because of insufficient outer covering for the plastic container. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: the container had been removed from other packages and placed in a blue hazmat bag, and a yellow container to keep the spill contained.
